_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:51:57 using v2.1
title: How have waiting times after an urgent referral changed by cancer type?
analysis_commentary:
Here we compare data from 2013/14 quarter 1 to 2014/15 quarter 1.The proportion of people having an outpatient appointment within two weeks varied slightly by cancer type, but remained above 92.0% for all cancer types in both years. The highest rates were seen for testicular cancer, lung cancer, haematological malignancies and leukaemia. The lowest rate in both years was seen for upper gastrointestinal cancer. For the majority of cancer types performance was worse in 2014/15 compared to 2013/14. In particular the proportion of people with an urgent referral for breast cancer seen within 2 weeks has decreased by 4.5 percentage points. Only leukaemia and brain cancer improved in performance in 2014/15 compared to 2013/14.

Please note that some of these cancers are very rare (data not shown) and changes in a small number of cases can have a large effect on the proportions.
